Understate: The claim understates the significant decrease in the number of people testing positive for influenza this season compared to the previous season.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support or evidence to back up its assertion of a "miracle" decrease in flu cases.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the decrease in flu cases is solely due to the COVID-19 lockdown restrictions and precautions, without providing any evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to acknowledge that other factors, such as high rates of flu vaccination, could also contribute to the decrease in flu cases.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that flu cases are indeed down dramatically, as supported by data from the CDC and public health experts.
Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the significance of the decrease in flu cases by using the term "miracle" and comparing it to a high number of cases from the previous year.
